===Etymology===
From {{etyl|zh|ja|sort=ほうり}} {{m|zh|鳳梨}},<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>, probably more specifically {{etyl|yue|ja|sort=ほうり}}, given that it was the Portuguese who first brought this fruit to East Asia, and the Portuguese were more active in southern China.

The [[pineapple]] was introduced to Japan relatively recently, with the earliest mentions around 1830.

The reading is the regular Japanese [[on'yomi]] ([[kan'on]]) for the {{etyl|zh|-}} spelling. Compare the modern {{etyl|yue|-}} reading ''fung<sup>6</sup> lei<sup>4</sup>''.
